div.head: U.S. Recognition of Cameroon, 1960.
div.p: The United States recognized the Republic of Cameroon on January 1, 1960, when U.S. Consul General at Yaounde Bolard More notified Cameroon authorities that the post was being elevated to an Embassy. On that same date, the United Nations ended the Trusteeship over Cameroon that had been administered by France.

div.head: Establishment of Diplomatic Relations and the American Embassy in Cameroon, 1960.
div.p: Diplomatic relations and the American Embassy in Cameroon were established on January 1, 1960, when the Consulate General at Yaounde was elevated to Embassy status, with Bolard More as Chargé d’Affaires ad interim.
